ygData.subject: Command-line NEAT
ygData.msgSnippet: Here s what I m thinking I want: An executable that encapsulates the NEAT-specific functionality.  For example, $ neat-gen .xml .xml

Here's what I'm thinking I want:

An executable that encapsulates the NEAT-specific functionality.  For 
example,

$ neat-gen <settings>.xml <in-pop>.xml <in-fit>.xml <out-pop>.xml 
<out-phenotype>.xml

Why separate it out from the main experiment loop?  Because I want the 
experiment loop to be controlled by CGI scripts.  I want it to be 
event-driven.  I want an experiment to be able to pick right up where it 
left off after a reboot or power outage.  Because my ultimate goal is a 
distributed NEAT that may take months to get anywhere... :(

Those of you with an existing NEAT implementation could probably convert it 
for use in this manner in about a half-hour, huh?  :)  And if you are 
willing to save me the effort, I wouldn't complain...

Otherwise, I'll probably build it in Perl, since that's the language I'm the 
most proficient in.  (YANI...yet another neat implementation.  :-) )  Before 
I begin, would any of you like to give me some tips or suggestions?  Some 
design suggestions that you perhaps wish you had thought of before you 
started?  Anything?  Thanks!

-- John
